name: Arc Scrollbars
description: Minimal scrollbars for Chromium (designed in and for Vivaldi.)
additional_info:
This is a part of the Arc for Vivaldi project, but it can be used independently. If you'd like to try out AFV, you can get it on Github here.

Arc Scrollbars was made in and for Vivaldi, but there's no reason they shouldn't work on other Chromium browsers. I may port it to Firefox as well at some point in the future.

This only affects web pages, as Stylish and Stylus are unable to modify internal pages. In order to have these scrollbars working on internal pages as well, copy the css and paste it into a custom.css in your Vivaldi style directory, then add #browser before each instance of ::webkit-scrollbar.

Features:

  • Decreases scrollbars' height and width by 7px to give more screen space to the content.
  • Makes scrollbar track transparent (is not the same thing as "overlay.")
  • Makes scrollbar thumb semi-transparent.
  • Removes scrollbar buttons.

I can't possibly be the only one who hates Chromium's scrollbars. They look incredibly out of place with the rest of the UI, especially in Vivaldi.
